titlepage.titleproper:
Finding aid for
Pittsfield Township records, 1830-1980
titlepage.author:
Finding aid created by
Mary Kenney, 2005 and Michigan Historical Collections staff

did.abstract: The Pittsfield Township (Washtenaw County, Mich.) records contain school district records for districts 1 through 8 and 8 fractional from 1860-1930, with occasional records dating back to 1830. The collection also contains a wide range of types of township records dealing with assessments, elections, finance, and legal activities, dating from 1832 to 1980. Township Board proceedings (1834-1965, with some gaps) and road records (1835-1887) are also available in digitized versions.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The record group was received from different sources. Pittsfield School District No. 7 (also known as Stone School (donor no. 2981) deposited its records in 1953. Other records came from the township office (donor no. 4972) in 1972 through township treasurer James D. Reader. Finally a history of the township schools was received from Julius Haab (donor no. 1854) in 1943. Additional records came from the township office in 2010 and 2012.

accruals.p: No further additions to the records are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open without restriction.

userestrict.p: Copyright is not held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Pittsfield Township records, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Pittsfield Township, created in 1834, was one of the earliest townships in Washtenaw County. The "History of the Rural Schools in Washtenaw County" found in the collection covers only Pittsfield Township. The history of each district was written by students. The entire history was given to the Michigan Historical Collection by Julius W. Haab. Miscellaneous school documents include the Centennial Celebration of Stone School in 1953.

arrangement.p: The school records of Pittsfield are arranged generally by district.

list.item: District 2 and 5 fractional - Pittsfield and York

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of the following series: Pittsfield School Districts records, Miscellaneous Township Responsibilities, Township Administration, Treasurer's records, Assessment Rolls, Tax Rolls, Rolls of Lands Upon Which Taxes Were Unpaid, and Other Assessments.

odd.p: (the volume also contains fragmentary information for 1964-1968)
